    This documentation is offered in Open Review format. We kindly request your feedback in case something is unclear, poorly written, or incorrect. Your input would greatly assist us in improving these documents and providing a better experience for you and our partners. To add your annotations, simply highlight the text and click on the pop-up menu. To view annotations from others, click on the top-right corner of the page

    Compute Communication default across the crisis indicator

    ind_6.Rd

    The indicator reveals whether - and to what extent - the duty of contracting authorities to communicate the public procurement procedure activation to the Anticorruption Authority ended with a technical failure

    Motivation:

    The red flag considers at risk contracting authorities who fail to accomplish their duty to communicate the public procurement procedure activation to the Anticorruption Authority

    Scoring Rule

    If Test-statistic significant-> 1, otherwise -> 0

    Main target unit

    This indicator targets contracting authorities

    Usage

    ind_6(data, publication_date, emergency_name, award_col, stat_unit, test_type)

    Arguments

    data

    mock_data_core example bdncp data

    publication_date

    The date when the tender was published

    emergency_name

    emergency name character string for which you want to evaluate the indicator, e.g. "Coronavirus" "Terremoto Aquila"

    award_col

    column indentifying id for that contract award

    stat_unit

    statistical unit of measurement and stat_uniting

    test_type

    type of the test we would like to apply

    Value

    indicator schema as from generate_indicator_schema

    See also

    ymd mutate, if_else, summarise, distinct, pull, rename, mutate-joins, arrange as_factor str_sub

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
if (interactive()) {
  data("mock_data_core")
  ind_6(
    data = mock_data_core,
    publication_date = data_pubblicazione,
    emergency_name = "coronavirus",
    award_col = id_aggiudicazione,
    stat_unit = provincia,
    test_type = "fisher"
  )
}
}
